numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed that students from higher-income families are more likely to be accepted into elite colleges than students from poor families.
3. From the graph, I see that students from legacy families are more likely to be accepted into elite colleges than students from non-legacy families.
4. I wonder whether this situation contributes to a cycle.
5. In this cycle, higher-income students are able to get into elite colleges.
6. In this cycle, students from poor families have a low chance of being accepted into elite colleges.
7. I ask whether there is a way to stop this cycle.
8. This situation relates to me and my community.
9. I think that everyone should have an equal opportunity to get into elite colleges.
10. Some people want to attend college.
11. Some people cannot attend college because of high costs.
12. Some people cannot attend college because of a lack of resources.
13. A name for the graph is "College Admissions: An Unfair Advantage".
